content:
I am currently preparing a presentation on the FHIR Mapping Language and I would like to give an overview of

a) all currently available or emerging implementations of Mapping engines (I know of Firely/Healex's .NET implementation and the Java validator, are there more...?)
b) all projects currently publishing/planning to publish StructureMaps
c) all project currently publishing/planning to publish LogicalModels (I know of the C-CDA-IG, V2 refactored, CDA seems abandoned?)

Please throw links at me!
Thanks!!
Would love a copy of your presentation when done! I have a 'sorta' IDE - which I blogged about here: https://fhirblog.com/2019/12/14/a-simple-app-to-help-using-the-mapping-language/

Very nice! This will absolutely be featured in the presentation :)
Iâ€˜ll put the slides up soon, however they will be in German (for now). ;-)

@Simone Heckmann
a) a server based mapping engine based on the java reference implementation and hapi is in development here https://github.com/ahdis/matchbox/blob/master/matchbox-fml.md, a test instance is availabe (but not yet documented at test.ahdis.ch/r4)
b) we have in switzerland a project for converting between our IHE Pharm based CDA's and FHIR Documents (and back), the maps are in development here
c) the CDA Logical Model (which I think the C-CDA is building upon) is here: cda-core-2.0

I'm looking for FHIR Mapping engines, I know about Vonk/Firely. Is there any other stable engine available?
Thanks!
please only ask questions in one stream at a time - answered under #implementers
